elements.text: Caltrans Construction Safety Services
Subheading: DVBE-Certified Safety & Health Services for California Highway Construction

Hero Text: EHS Analytical Solutions provides comprehensive safety and health services for Caltrans construction projects across all 12 California districts. As a Disabled Veteran Business Enterprise (DVBE), we support general contractors with Safety Representatives, Safety Quality Control Managers, Work Area Monitoring, and complete Cal/OSHA compliance programs for highway and bridge construction.

elements.description: Caltrans highway construction project, bridge work, or Cal/OSHA safety inspection

elements.text: Caltrans Safety & Health Expertise

Body Text: With extensive experience in Caltrans Standard Specifications and Special Provisions, our Certified Industrial Hygienists (CIH) and Certified Safety Professionals (CSP) provide the safety oversight and compliance documentation required for successful Caltrans project completion. We serve all 12 Caltrans districts and understand the unique requirements of California highway construction. Our team is thoroughly trained in Cal/OSHA Title 8 regulations, Caltrans Standard Specifications Section 7 (Safety Requirements), and California-specific construction safety protocols.
Comprehensive Caltrans Safety Services Layout: Grid format with 6 service boxes

Service Box 1: Lead Compliance Plan (LCP) Services For projects involving lead-containing paint on bridges and structures, we develop comprehensive Lead Compliance Plans per Cal/OSHA Section 1532.1 and Caltrans Special Provisions Section 7-1.02K9. Our CIH-certified staff handle exposure assessment, engineering controls, worker training, and ongoing compliance monitoring. Learn more about our dedicated Lead Compliance Plan Services → [Link to: /lead-compliance-plan-services/]

Service Box 2: Safety Representative Services Our Safety Representatives provide on-site safety oversight and Cal/OSHA compliance monitoring for Caltrans construction projects. Services include daily jobsite inspections, safety meeting facilitation, incident investigation, and coordination with Caltrans Resident Engineers per Section 5-1.28 Project Safety Reviews.
Key Responsibilities:

items: Daily safety inspections and hazard identification
Safety meeting coordination with Resident Engineer
Job Hazard Analysis (JHA) review per Section 5-1.29

elements.text: Service Box 3: Public Health and Safety Plan (PHSP) We develop comprehensive Public Health and Safety Plans for Caltrans projects requiring stakeholder coordination and public safety protocols. Our plans address construction impacts on surrounding communities, emergency response procedures, and regulatory compliance for projects near schools, hospitals, and residential areas.
PHSP Components:

items: Traffic control and pedestrian safety measures

elements.text: Service Box 4: Work Area Monitoring (WAM) - Bridge Projects For bridge rehabilitation and painting projects, we provide Work Area Monitoring services including air quality monitoring, worker exposure assessment, and real-time compliance verification. Our monitoring programs ensure contractor adherence to Lead Compliance Plans and protect workers from lead, silica, and other construction hazards.
WAM Services Include:

items: Personal and area air monitoring for lead and silica

elements.text: Service Box 5: Health & Safety Plan (HSP) Development We create site-specific Health & Safety Plans tailored to your Caltrans project requirements. Our plans integrate Cal/OSHA regulations, Caltrans Standard Specifications, and project-specific hazard controls to provide comprehensive safety management throughout construction.
HSP Elements:

SQCM services include safety program audits, documentation review, Cal/OSHA compliance verification, and coordination with project quality control teams.

elements.text: Ready to Include Us in Your Caltrans Bid?

Body Text: Contact us today for fast, competitive pricing on Caltrans safety services. As a DVBE-certified firm, we help you meet small business participation goals while providing the highest level of safety expertise.
CTA Buttons: [Request Quote] [Download Capability Statement] [View Lead Compliance Services]
Contact Information: Phone: (619) 288-3094 Email: adam@ehsanalytical.com Based in San Diego, serving all 12 Caltrans districts

Frequently Asked Questions Q: Do you provide Safety Representatives for all project sizes? A: Yes, we support projects from small maintenance contracts to large highway construction projects exceeding $50M. Our team can scale services to match your project requirements. Q: Can you respond quickly during bidding season? A: Absolutely. We understand Caltrans bid deadlines are tight. We provide quotes within 24-48 hours and can turn around last-minute requests even faster with advance notice. Q: How does your DVBE certification help our bid? A: Caltrans awards a 5% bid preference to contractors who meet DVBE participation goals. Our subcontract counts toward your DVBE participation, making your bid more competitive. Q: Do you work directly with Caltrans Resident Engineers? A: Yes, our Safety Representatives attend all required meetings with the Resident Engineer, complete Cal/OSHA required Project Safety Reviews per Section 5-1.28, and handle all safety-related submittals and documentation. Q: Can you provide services in multiple districts simultaneously? A: Yes, we have the staff and resources to support multiple concurrent projects across different Caltrans districts.
